SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.screen

Class LevelScreen

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.screen.LevelScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
HealthChangeHandler
public class LevelScreen extends Object implements HealthChangeHandler
The LevelScreen class is responsible for displaying the current level's background, instructions, and heart displays for players. It implements the HealthChangeHandler interface to update the heart display when a player's health changes.

This class provides methods to initialize the background, show level instructions, update the background for a scrolling effect, and manage heart displays for players.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelScreen

      public LevelScreen(javafx.scene.Group root, int currentLevelNumber)
      Constructs a new LevelView instance.
      Parameters:
      root - the root group node for the scene graph
      currentLevelNumber - the current level number to be displayed

  • Method Details

    • initializeBackground

      public void initializeBackground()
      Initializes the background for the level view by creating two ImageView objects with the background image for the current level. The images are positioned side by side to create a seamless scrolling effect. The images are set to the screen height and width, and their opacity is set to 0.7. The images are then added to the UI layer.

    • showInstructions

      public void showInstructions()
      Displays the instructions for the current level on the screen. The instructions are displayed as a text element with a specific font, size, and color. The position and wrapping width of the text are also set. The text is added to the root node of the scene graph.

    • updateBackground

      public void updateBackground()
      Updates the background images by moving them to the left based on the scroll speed. If an image moves completely out of view, it resets its position to the right edge of the screen.

    • onHealthChange

      public void onHealthChange(UserPlane player, int newHealth)
      Updates the heart display for the given player when their health changes.
      Specified by:
      onHealthChange in interface HealthChangeHandler
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose health has changed.
      newHealth - The new health value of the player.

    • showHeartDisplay

      public void showHeartDisplay(UserPlane player, int playerIndex)
      Displays the heart display for the given player if it does not already exist.
      Parameters:
      player - The UserPlane object representing the player.
      playerIndex - The index of the player.
